Event.name: Cause_change
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> causes an <fen>Entity</fen> to change, either in its category membership or in terms of the value of an <fen>Attribute</fen>. In the former case, an <fen>Initial_category</fen> and a <fen>Final_category</fen> may be expressed, in the latter case an <fen>Initial_value</fen> and a <fen>Final_value</fen> can be specified.
<ex>Our storylines follows the saga outlined by the Ultima Series, but <fex name="age">we</fex> have <t>modified</t> <fex name="ent">it</fex> <fex name="pur">in order to make our writing more cohesive</fex>.</ex>
<ex>I don't think <fex name="Agent">you</fex> can <t>turn</t> <fex name="ent">that rabbit</fex> <fex name="finc">into a hat</fex>.</ex>
<ex>How can <fex name="age">a guy that</fex> <t>changed</t> <fex name="att">his name</fex> <fex name="iniv">from Bob Craft</fex> <fex name="finv">to Jack Ass</fex> declare anyone defamed his character?</ex>
<ex> <fex name="tim">At this juncture</fex>, <fex name="cau">a new development</fex> <t>changed</t> <fex name="ent">the political situation on the island</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="age">She</fex> had <fex name="tim">at some time earlier</fex> <fex name="deg">completely</fex> <t>changed</t> <fex name="att">her clothing and appearance</fex> and now stood in front of me dressed like a garden gnome.</ex>
<ex>Hence, when <fex name="ent">(Hg 0 )</fex> is <t>converted</t> <fex name="finc">to Hg 2+</fex> , it can be rapidly taken up in rain water, snow, or adsorbed onto small particles</ex> <ex>Hence, when <fex name="inic">(Hg 0 )</fex> is <t>converted</t> to Hg 2+ , it can be rapidly taken up in rain water, snow, or adsorbed onto small particles</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The sentient entity that effects a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex><fex name="age">The system administrator</fex> <t>changed</t> the value from 'KDE' to 'GNOME', and then restarted the system.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_category
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The category of which the <fen>Entity</fen> is a member before the <fen>Agent</fen> causes a change.
<ex>Her time with the Healer Craft has <t>changed</t> her <fex name="inic">from a shy, nervous young girl</fex> into a confident (almost) young woman</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Final_category
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to after it has undergone the change.
<ex>The radical message of the cross transformed Saul of Tarsus and <t>changed</t> him from a persecutor of Christians <fex name="finc">to a tender believer</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Final_value
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> assumes as a result of the change that the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused to undergo.
<ex>We <t>changed</t> the size from 8 1/2x11 <fex name="finv">to a larger 11 x 17</fex> and gave it a complete graphical makeover. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_value
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> has before the change takes place.
<ex>My dad <t>changed</t> his hair color <fex name="iniv">from red</fex> to blue today.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
<ex>He <t>changed</t> it <fex name="tim">after David Bowie told him that only twerps have the same first and last name</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the initial and final categories or values differ from each other.
<ex>We <fex name="deg">significantly</fex> <t>changed</t> its appearance during this time. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root> Any description of the event causing the change of the Entity which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Agent that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
<ex>Taking out his Driver's Ed pass certificate, Blair <fex name="man">carefully</fex> <t>changed</t> the '6' of 1969 to an '8' making it read 23rd February 1989.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> is responding to in bringing about the change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>I didn't <t>change</t> its name <fex name="Explanation">because I think it has already got used to it</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Attribute
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A characteristic of the <fen>Entity</fen> for which a value can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement , or observation.
<ex>We <t>changed</t> <fex name="att">the price</fex> from $1.26 to $1.27 per pint.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Entity
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The abstract or concrete thing or situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to change.
<ex>The recent terrorist attacks had <t>changed</t> <fex name="ent">the political climate</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An event that causes a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex><fex name="cau">Major technological innovations</fex> <t>changed</t> the social and economic conditions.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Agent</fen> intends to accomplish by effecting a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>His real name is Jerry Rivers, but he <t>changed</t> it <fex name="pur">in order to sound more ethnic and appealing</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> (or event resulting from the <fen>Cause</fen>) that produces a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>Ling said he had <t>transformed</t> the car <fex name="Means">by putting slicks on</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location where the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
<ex><fex name="pla">In his own room</fex> he had <t>modified</t> nothing.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Role
Arg.definition: <def-root>The particular role that the <fen>Agent</fen> plays in the Cause_change event. </def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. </def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: turn.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to change into a different kind of entity.

lexUnit.name: change.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: alter into a different forms.

lexUnit.name: transform.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to have an altered nature.

lexUnit.name: modify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make partial changes to (something) in order to improve it or lessen its severity

lexUnit.name: alter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: change in character, appearance, direction, etc.

lexUnit.name: alteration.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of making something different without changing its category

lexUnit.name: conversion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the process or action of converting or of being converted

lexUnit.name: transformation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a marked change in form caused by a stimulus

lexUnit.name: vary.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: modify or change (something) to make it less uniform.

lexUnit.name: variation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a change or slight difference in condition, amount, or level.

lexUnit.name: reshape.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shape or form (something) differently or again.

lexUnit.name: shift.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to change from one category or value to another

lexUnit.name: deform.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: distort the shape or form of
